com.acrolinx.javasdk.api.factory

Interface AcrolinxFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AcrolinxFactoryImpl, GuiFactory

    public interface AcrolinxFactory
    A factory for creating Java SDK objects. The AcrolinxFactory is the starting point for any integration. Call AcrolinxFactoryInstantiator.get() to get your instance of the AcrolinxFactory.

    Use the AcrolinxFactory to:
    • create your ClientInformation containing the client signature via clientInformations()
    • create your AcrolinxClient via createClient(ClientInformation, ApplicationStore)
    • create documents to check via documents()
    • lookup a server using AcrolinxClient.lookupServer(ServerEndpointConfiguration)
    • take the shortcut to a server connection via createServerConnection(ClientInformation, ApplicationStore, ConnectionSettings) and for many more great things


    You should have received some information and demo clients from Acrolinx. If not, you may want to take a look at the snippets in the documentation bundle.
    Note: If you want to use Dialog you may have a look at GuiFactory, GuiSwtFactory and GuiSwingFactory. The GuiFactory also supports different stores for CheckSettings, ConnectionSettings and much more.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  AcrolinxFactory.NoOpLogger
      The AcrolinxFactory.NoOpLogger is some kind of null object.

      SingleSignOnConfigurations singleSignOnConfigurations() 
      TerminologyQueryBuilderFactory terminologyQueries()
      TerminologyQueryBuilderFactory is used to create a TerminologyQueryBuilder to set parameters for TerminologyQuery which is used to look up terms in the terminology database.

    • Method Detail

      • additionalDatas

        AdditionalDatasFactory additionalDatas()
        AdditionalData is used to display additional information in checking report.
        Returns:
        factory for creating AdditionalData

      • applicationStores

        ApplicationStores applicationStores()
        ApplicationStores are used to store information like authentication tokens. It also could be used to store ConnectionSettings, PluginSettings and CheckSettings.
        Returns:
        factory for creating ApplicationStores

      • checkInformations

        CheckInformationsFactory checkInformations()
        Returns:
        The factory for creating CheckInformations.

      • checkSettings

        CheckSettingsBuilderFactory checkSettings()
        Returns:
        The factory for creating CheckSettings.

      • clientInformations

        ClientInformationsFactory clientInformations()
        Returns:
        The factory for creating ClientInformations.

      • connectionSettings

        ConnectionSettingsFactory connectionSettings()
        Returns:
        The factory for creating ConnectionSettings.

      • contextInformations

        ContextInformationsFactory contextInformations()
        Returns:
        The factory for creating ContextInformations.

      • createClient

        AcrolinxClient createClient(ClientInformation clientInformation,
                          ApplicationStore applicationStore)
        Creates a new AcrolinxClient. The AcrolinxClient holds all client-specific information.
        Note: If you just want to connect to one server you also could use the shortcut createServerConnection(ClientInformation, ApplicationStore, ConnectionSettings)
        Parameters:
        clientInformation - The ClientInformation: create via checkInformations()
        applicationStore - The ApplicationStore: create via applicationStores() or easily implement your own.
        Returns:
        The AcrolinxClient ready for connecting to a server.
        See: AcrolinxClient.lookupServer(ServerEndpointConfiguration) and AcrolinxClient.connect(ConnectionSettings)

      • createServerConnection

        ServerConnection createServerConnection(ClientInformation clientInformation,
                                      ApplicationStore applicationStore,
                                      ConnectionSettings connectionSettings)
        Established a ServerConnection. It is some kind of shortcut if you just want to communicate to one server. In other cases you should fist create a AcrolinxClient via createClient(ClientInformation, ApplicationStore) and connect via AcrolinxClient.connect(ConnectionSettings).
        Parameters:
        clientInformation - The ClientInformation: create via clientInformations()
        applicationStore - The ApplicationStore: create via applicationStores() or easily implement your own.
        connectionSettings - The ConnectionSettings: create via connectionSettings()
        Returns:
        The established ServerConnection to the Acrolinx Server.

      • dictionaryEntries

        DictionaryEntriesFactory dictionaryEntries()
        Returns:
        The factory to create DictionaryEntrys.

      • documents

        DocumentsFactory documents()
        Returns:
        The factory to create Documents.

      • getVersion

        String getVersion()
        Returns:
        the version and the build number of the Java SDK as string in the format "(VERSION) B(BUILDNUMBER)", for example "1.2 B123"

      • metaInfos

        MetaInfosFactory metaInfos()
        Returns:
        The factory for creating MetaInfos.

      • proxySettings

        ProxySettingsFactory proxySettings()
        Returns:
        The factory for creating ProxySettings.

      • singleSignOnConfigurations

        SingleSignOnConfigurations singleSignOnConfigurations()
        Returns:
        The factory for creating SingleSignOnConfigurations. Additional configuration needs to be done on server. See Infocenter

      • serverEndpointConfigurations

        ServerEndpointConfigurationsFactory serverEndpointConfigurations()
        ServerEndpointConfigurations are used to specify all relevant information to look up a ServerEndpoint. A ServerEndpoint could be used to connect to an Acrolinx Server.
        Returns:
        The factory for creating ServerEndpointConfigurations.

      • documentCheckSettings

        DocumentCheckSettingsFactory documentCheckSettings()

      • terminologyQueries

        TerminologyQueryBuilderFactory terminologyQueries()
        TerminologyQueryBuilderFactory is used to create a TerminologyQueryBuilder to set parameters for TerminologyQuery which is used to look up terms in the terminology database.
        Returns:
        A builder for TerminologyQuery.
